title: How Many Calories Are in IPA Beer?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in IPA beer per standard 12 oz serving, including carbs, alcohol content, and variations for different styles.
h1: How Many Calories Are in IPA Beer?
assumptions: Standard India Pale Ale (IPA), 6-7% ABV, unfiltered or filtered, no added flavors; 12 fl oz (355 ml) bottle or can.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, hop variety, and brewing method. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One 12 oz serving of IPA beer contains about 215 kcal, mostly from carbs and alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to a light IPA (lower ABV ~4.5%)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a 12 oz IPA beer?
faqs.a: Approximately 215 kcal for a standard IPA.

faqs.q: Do IPAs have more calories than regular beer?
faqs.a: Yes, due to higher ABV and carbs; IPAs average 200-250 kcal vs. 150 for light lagers.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in IPA beer?
faqs.a: Primarily alcohol (7 kcal/g) and carbohydrates from malted barley.
Yes, light or session IPAs can be 100-170 kcal per 12 oz.

faqs.q: How does IPA beer nutrition compare to other beers?
faqs.a: Higher carbs (15g) and calories than pilsners, but low fat/protein like most beers.
